meta.name: description
meta.content: The 303 See Other HTTP status code tells clients the request was processed and the workflow can be completed by visiting a different URI.

main.p: The 303 See Other HTTP status code indicates the result of the operation is available at another location. The client should interpret the request as completed, and then make a new request to another resource identified by the Location header. The new request must be made with GET (or HEAD)

Servers will typically only produce 303 See Other in response to POST requests, so that after a browser has submitted from a form, the browser can make a safe request to show the user the result; whereas if the resource generated a response to the POST request directly, the browser would not be able to re-request the page that was returned.
A 303 See Other will be accompnied by a Location header that indicates the next page that should be loaded.

The request-URI should not be pushed to the history, so that navigation brings the user to the redirect target, instead of re-issuing the request that caused the 303. If the user intends to re-issue the request, they can re-submit the form.

dl.dd: The request was completed and the result is available at another location.

dd.a: RFC 7538: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol Status Code 303 (Permanent Redirect)
